description: Our technology makes it easy to access high-quality transaction data, validate account ownership, and mitigate risks in a user-friendly way

events.name: webhookEvent
steps: Navigate to updateItemWebhook or createItemWebhook block

blocks.name: getAccessToken
blocks.description: Exchange a Link publicToken for an API accessToken.

args.name: clientId
args.info: Private API key from user dashboard.

args.name: secret
args.info: Private API key from user dashboard.

args.name: publicToken
args.info: Short-lived API token.

blocks.name: getItem
blocks.description: The getItem endpoint returns information about the status of an Item: Available products; Billed products; Error status; Institution ID (institution_id);Item ID (item_id); Webhook;

args.name: clientId
args.info: Private API key from user dashboard.

args.name: secret
args.info: Private API key from user dashboard.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: A rotatable API token unique to a single Item.

blocks.name: getAuth
blocks.description: The getAuth endpoint allows you to retrieve the bank account and routing numbers associated with an Item’s checking and savings accounts, along with high-level account data and balances.

args.name: clientId
args.info: Private API key from user dashboard.

args.name: secret
args.info: Private API key from user dashboard.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: A rotatable API token unique to a single Item.

args.name: accountIds
args.info: A list of accountIds to retrieve for the Item.Note: An error will be returned if a provided accountId is not associated with the Item.

blocks.name: getAccountsBalance
blocks.description: The getAccountsBalance endpoint returns the real-time balance for each of an Item’s accounts.

args.name: clientId
args.info: Private API key from user dashboard.

args.name: secret
args.info: Private API key from user dashboard.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: A rotatable API token unique to a single Item.

args.name: accountIds
args.info: A list of accountIds to retrieve for the Item.Note: An error will be returned if a provided accountId is not associated with the Item.

blocks.name: getInstitutions
blocks.description: Returns a JSON response containing details on all financial institutions currently supported by Plaid.

args.name: clientId
args.info: Private API key from user dashboard.

args.name: secret
args.info: Private API key from user dashboard.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: A rotatable API token unique to a single Item.

args.name: count
args.info: The total number of Institutions to return. The minimum is 0 and the maximum is 500.

args.name: offset
args.info: The number of Institutions to skip before returning results. The minimum is 1. There is no maximum.

args.name: ProductsType
args.info: A list of accountIds to retrieve for the Item.Note: An error will be returned if a provided accountId is not associated with the Item.

blocks.name: getInstitutionById
blocks.description: Returns a JSON response containing details on a specified financial institution currently supported by Plaid.

args.name: PublicKey
args.info: Private API key from user dashboard.

args.name: institutionId
args.info: Single institution id.

blocks.name: getCategories
blocks.description: Send a request to the getCategories endpoint to get detailed information on categories returned by Plaid. This endpoint does not require authentication.

blocks.name: searchInstitution
blocks.description: Returns a JSON response containing details on a specified financial institution currently supported by Plaid.

args.name: PublicKey
args.info: Private API key from user dashboard.

args.name: productsType
args.info: Filter the Institutions based on whether they support all products listed in products.

args.name: querySearch
args.info: The search query.Institutions with names matching the query are returned.

blocks.name: createItemWebhook
blocks.description: The createItemWebhook allows you to create the webhook associated with an Item.

args.name: clientId
args.info: Private API key from user dashboard.

args.name: secret
args.info: Private API key from user dashboard.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: A rotatable API token unique to a single Item.

args.name: webhookUrl
args.info: The new webhookUrl to associate with the Item.

blocks.name: updateItemWebhook
blocks.description: The updateItemWebhook allows you to update the webhook associated with an Item.

args.name: clientId
args.info: Private API key from user dashboard.

args.name: secret
args.info: Private API key from user dashboard.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: A rotatable API token unique to a single Item.

args.name: webhookUrl
args.info: The new webhookUrl to associate with the Item.

blocks.name: getAccounts
blocks.description: The getAccounts endpoint returns information about accounts.

args.name: clientId
args.info: Private API key from user dashboard.

args.name: secret
args.info: Private API key from user dashboard.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: A rotatable API token unique to a single Item.

blocks.name: getPublicToken
blocks.description: If you need your user to take action to restore or resolve an error associated with an Item, generate a public token with the getAccounts.

args.name: clientId
args.info: Private API key from user dashboard.

args.name: secret
args.info: Private API key from user dashboard.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: A rotatable API token unique to a single Item.

blocks.name: getAccountsTransactions
blocks.description: The getAccountsTransactions endpoint allows developers to receive user-authorized transaction data for credit and depository-type Accounts.

args.name: clientId
args.info: Private API key from user dashboard.

args.name: secret
args.info: Private API key from user dashboard.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: A rotatable API token unique to a single Item.

args.name: startDate
args.info: Starting date of transaction processing.

args.name: endDate
args.info: Ending date of transaction processing.

args.name: count
args.info: The total number of transactions to return.

args.name: offset
args.info: The number of transaction to skip before returning results.

blocks.name: rotateAccessToken
blocks.description: You can use the rotateAccessToken endpoint to rotate the accessToken associated with an Item.

args.name: clientId
args.info: Private API key from user dashboard.

args.name: secret
args.info: Private API key from user dashboard.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: A rotatable API token unique to a single Item.

blocks.name: updateAccessTokenVersion
blocks.description: Calling this endpoint does not revoke the legacy API access_token. You can still use the legacy access_token in the legacy API environment to retrieve data.

args.name: clientId
args.info: Private API key from user dashboard.

args.name: secret
args.info: Private API key from user dashboard.

args.name: accessTokenOld
args.info: accessToken from the legacy version of Plaid’s API.

blocks.name: getIncome
blocks.description: The getIncome endpoint allows you to retrieve information pertaining to a Item’s income.

args.name: clientId
args.info: Private API key from user dashboard.

args.name: secret
args.info: Private API key from user dashboard.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: A rotatable API token unique to a single Item.

blocks.name: getIdentity
blocks.description: The getIdentity endpoint allows you to retrieve various account holder information on file with the financial institution, including names, emails, phone numbers, and addresses.

args.name: clientId
args.info: Private API key from user dashboard.

args.name: secret
args.info: Private API key from user dashboard.

args.name: accessTokenOld
args.info: A rotatable API token unique to a single Item.

blocks.name: deleteItem
blocks.description: The deleteItem endpoint allows you to delete an Item

args.name: clientId
args.info: Private API key from user dashboard.

args.name: secret
args.info: Private API key from user dashboard.

args.name: accessTokenOld
args.info: A rotatable API token unique to a single Item.

blocks.name: resetItemLogin
blocks.description: The resetItemLogin endpoint allows you put an Item in an ITEM_LOGIN_REQUIRED error state.

args.name: clientId
args.info: Private API key from user dashboard.

args.name: secret
args.info: Private API key from user dashboard.

args.name: accessTokenOld
args.info: A rotatable API token unique to a single Item.
